answers.answer: You would normally get induced by 41 weeks, but it depends on your Dr and what's going on with the baby. Some women get induced because of medical concerns, which can happen anytime and vary. I agree with you that inducing early for no reason other than being impatient is wrong, but do know that many have legitimate reasons for needing to.

Well there are alot of reasons. It could be medically nec. Or they are over due. And once ypu get to your 3rd trimester you will get it. Lol its wonderful but very tiring and painful at times but no doctor will induce unless ots an emergency or if you are full term and are ready.

I'm being induced in 12 days an will be 39 weeks I don't have a choice I previously have high blood pressure and doc said more pregnant you are the higher chance of preclampsia.... so doc knows what is best
Ok definitely get it now.. nvr thought of medical problems or concerns. . Thanks ladies!

My Dr chose to induce with my first pregnancy because of medical reasons. She wanted to make sure that I was in a safe environment through the entire delivery. I had some elevated protein levels; which was an indication of spina bifida, club foot, down syndrome, and etc. Once that was ruled out my Dr wanted to induce to make sure my son was born healthy. He was!

Even doctors nowadays will induce just because it is convenient.  You are right that being induced for impatience is silly.  The average ftm (without intervention) is one week and five days late.  Also vbacs are very doable.  My mother had one 26 years ago with two children!  Many women just don't know their options and just do what their doctor says without any research themselves.  Doctors treat being pregnant as a disease that needs to be cured instead of a natural process.  That is the main reason I went with a homebirth.

I personally won't consider being induced until I'm a week late unless it's for medical reasons. Even then, might wait until 2 weeks! I think most people just get impatient and want the baby here because pregnancy is difficult, but how I see it that's the sacrifice we make to help our children be healthy. I think also we forget it our due dates are estimates, and it's completely normal and common to go past it! To each their own though, everyone's situations and pregnancies are different. Maybe with my next I'll be misserable and asking them to take the baby early haha. Right now I'm 39 weeks and content with whenever he comes. I'm prepared for him now, but enjoying the time my husband and I have just us.

I was induced with my first at 38w because he was bigger than my body would be able to handle for a vaginal birth. My second was induced at 40+2 and he was bigger than my first and tore me. My 3rd & 4th were induced at 39w and were also bigger than my first 2. The way things are going right now I'm 33+3 and he is already big I may have to be induced if he doesn't come early.
I will be induced this week because I have GD . I am 39 weeks and 2 days. I really I hope go to labor by my own.
I am getting induced at 41 weeks because of possible complications from gestational diabetes.

I've been induced with all 3 for medical reasons - my first two were due to gestational diabetes and going a week & a half passed my due date with both. I was one day away from my due date with my third, my son was suffering complications which were discovered through non-stress tests and due to his umbilical cord being tightly wrapped around his neck twice. But I think that if there is no medical reason then it shouldn't be an option.

question: Hi everyone!  Im a rst time mom and 6 weeks pregnant.  Ive been reading a lot on here that women want to get induced or they are upset because their dr is making them wait a few more days... if the baby is ready to come then he or she will come.. i dont understand getting induced to rush things.. like i said im very new to this so i would like to be as prepared as possible in case im in a similar situation.
title: why do you get induced?
